alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 9:51AM EST until January 14 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Chatham affecting Morris and Somerset Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is still occurring. * WHERE...Passaic River at Chatham. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Open areas adjacent to the Passaic River flood in New Providence, Chatham Township, and Berkley Heights. At 6.0 feet, Portions of the Shepard Kolluck Park in Chatham floods. River Road by Henry Drive is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 01/27/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Passaic River Chatham 6.0 6.0 Sun 9 am 5.8 5.6 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 130 PM EST.
